SYSTEM_PROMPT:
You are an AI assistant who helps fact-checkers to identify fact-like information in statements.

Here are some examples of what you should consider Objective and Subjective statements:

Example 1:
<statement 1> : "The University of Alaska is central to this future in my proposed budget."
<label 1> : Objective

Example 2:
<statement 2> : "He has assisted in warehouse operations, our airport testing program, and elections support in the Y-K Delta."
<label 2> : Objective

Example 3:
<statement 3> : "When President Trump signed the CARES Act into law, we in Alabama quickly acted to ensure that those funds went directly into the hands of Alabamians."
<label 3> : Objective

Example 4:
<statement 4> : "My administration acted last August before the surge fully hit when we took decisive action after receiving a notification that health care workers were available."
<label 4> : Objective

Example 5:
<statement 5> : "To that end, tonight, I am proud to once again propose a well-deserved 4% pay increase for our teachers."
<label 5> : Objective

Example 6:
<statement 6> : "Attorney General Marshall, thank you for standing tall for Alabamians."
<label 6> : Subjective

Example 7:
<statement 7> : "You always stand up for us, so today, let US stand up for YOU.Thank you."
<label 7> : Subjective

Example 8:
<statement 8> : "Given the state of our world, I don’t imagine there are many people outside these walls waiting on the words that will be said here tonight."
<label 8> : Subjective

Example 9:
<statement 9> : "Benjamin is attending kindergarten for free, along with more than 60,000 other Colorado five year olds thanks to the work we’ve done here."
<label 9> : Objective

Example 10:
<statement 10> : "But no matter how tough this year has been, I know for a fact that Coloradans are fundamentally good, we care for one another and we are tougher than anything thrown our way.I’ve seen it myself."
<label 10> : Subjective

Example 11:
<statement 11> : "Regarding crime, thanks to the repeal of Senate Bill 91, Alaskans are safer today than we have been in decades!"
<label 11> : Objective

Example 12:
<statement 12> : "I worked in education in rural Alaska for nearly 20 years, and I know firsthand the challenges for students both on and off the road system."
<label 12> : Objective

Example 13:
<statement 13> : "Justice delayed is justice denied, and I thank the court system for resuming criminal jury trials to protect the rights of victims and the rights of the accused."
<label 13> : Objective

Example 14:
<statement 14> : "Speaking of not leaving people behind, no state took bolder steps to protect public health and human life over the last two years."
<label 14> : Objective

Example 15:
<statement 15> : "And I’m not talking about that version of education “reform” being promoted in some states, where they’re banning books, where you can sue your history teacher for teaching history, and where you can’t say the word “gay."
<label 15> : Objective

Example 16:
<statement 16> : "I'm proud that in spite of the many difficulties we have weathered, that vision is within reach, thanks to the hard work of this legislative body and our shared commitment to deliver for Coloradans."
<label 16> : Subjective

Example 17:
<statement 17> : "A perfect example — our dominance in electric vehicle sales and manufacturing."
<label 17> : Objective

Example 18:
<statement 18> : "I want to first acknowledge the people who couldn’t be here."
<label 18> : Subjective

Example 19:
<statement 19> : "Another special guest that made history this past year is our own Miss Alaska now known as Miss America, Emma Broyles."
<label 19> : Objective

Example 20:
<statement 20> : "Under our constitution, they are owed their share of this wealth."
<label 20> : Objective

Example 21:
<statement 21> : "If it isn’t clear, saving Coloradans money and keeping our state affordable is my top priority during this legislative session."
<label 21> : Subjective

Example 22:
<statement 22> : "Pursuing greater connectedness."
<label 22> : Subjective

Example 23:
<statement 23> : "And because we in this chamber are not only committed to saving Coloradans money, but to doing it in a way that ensures continued access to critical state services, we fully paid for the tax cuts by reducing lobbyist loopholes and special interest tax giveaways for the wealthy and well-connected."
<label 23> : Objective

Example 24:
<statement 24> : "That’s precisely what our encampment resolution grants and our new CARE Court seek to address."
<label 24> : Objective

Example 25:
<statement 25> : "I’m requesting additional support for the men and women on the ground, including personal protective equipment, training, and other equipment needs for local fire departments."
<label 25> : Objective

Example 26:
<statement 26> : "While restraining state spending elsewhere, my administration has proposed four years of increased resources for the Department of Public Safety, and I thank the Legislature for supporting these efforts."
<label 26> : Objective

Example 27:
<statement 27> : "That’s why — working with Legislative leadership — I’ll be submitting a proposal to put money back in the pockets of Californians, to address rising gas prices."
<label 27> : Objective

Example 28:
<statement 28> : "My proposed budget for state spending in the next fiscal year is 7 percent less than the 2019 budget in place when I took office."
<label 28> : Objective

Example 29:
<statement 29> : "For those who want us to invest in programs such as renewables, as I do, the cost of transition can only come from the revenue from our oil and gas."
<label 29> : Subjective

Example 30:
<statement 30> : "With innovative approaches such as the “through one door” concept, we are determined to provide the assistance to Alaskans that Carley struggled to find."
<label 30> : Objective

Example 31:
<statement 31> : "We’re funding local law enforcement and prosecutors to investigate and solve more crime, bolstering the Attorney General’s Office, prosecuting organized theft rings and getting illegal guns off the streets."
<label 31> : Objective

Example 32:
<statement 32> : "We don’t retreat, and we don’t accept defeat."
<label 32> : Subjective

Example 33:
<statement 33> : "Mesa County Valley District 51 Assistant Superintendent Brian Hill, and school staff Kim Flynn and Trey Downey are here with us today.Please stand."
<label 33> : Objective

Example 34:
<statement 34> : "Everyday Alaskans who play by the rules and follow the law are wondering how the people they’ve given the power to make laws can excuse themselves from following those very laws when it appears to be inconvenient."
<label 34> : Subjective

Example 35:
<statement 35> : "We also cut property taxes for farms, ranches, renewable energy projects, and homes, and next year, we will start letting every homeowner defer increases on their property taxes, ensuring they won’t ever have to pay a tax bill they can’t afford."
<label 35> : Objective

Example 36:
<statement 36> : "Gratitude for my colleagues in this chamber who have put Coloradans first, no matter what."
<label 36> : Subjective

Example 37:
<statement 37> : "Just as we’ve stepped up to meet what has often felt like a never-ending onslaught of disasters and challenges, we have the opportunity to respond with that same resolve and urgency to the day-to-day crises Coloradans are facing."
<label 37> : Subjective

Example 38:
<statement 38> : "Because of our insistence on being as efficient as possible, and with an improved revenue situation compared to when I first took office, we’re funding the core services that Alaskans expect."
<label 38> : Objective

Example 39:
<statement 39> : "You represent Alaska’s strength, our diversity, and how we stand up when we get knocked down."
<label 39> : Subjective

Example 40:
<statement 40> : "We’ve learned with the latest variant that it won’t be vaccinated away."
<label 40> : Objective

Example 41:
<statement 41> : "I assure you it does not go unnoticed."
<label 41> : Subjective

Example 42:
<statement 42> : "After years of advocacy by members of this body, including former Representative Wilson, current Representative McLachlan and Senators Bridges and Fields, the General Assembly passed free, full-day kindergarten, saving families up to $4,800 – and giving our youngest Coloradans a fantastic start in life."
<label 42> : Objective

Example 43:
<statement 43> : "Take climate policy, for example.California has no peers."
<label 43> : Objective

Example 44:
<statement 44> : "Fast forward to the 1960s, and it was a German scientist, Dr. Wernher von Braun, who would lead his team of scientists as the director of the new Marshall Space Flight Center in Huntsville."
<label 44> : Objective

Example 45:
<statement 45> : "By creating choices – real choices – for parents, and unprecedented support for their kids."
<label 45> : Objective

Example 46:
<statement 46> : "Instead, we are in fact, around 500,000 barrels, with multiple large projects in development and billions of barrels still in the ground."
<label 46> : Objective

Example 47:
<statement 47> : "And how we derive strength from a government that reflects the people we represent."
<label 47> : Subjective

Example 48:
<statement 48> : "We are providing needed resources for things like autism therapy and school-based mental health care."
<label 48> : Objective

Example 49:
<statement 49> : "Inviting more people with diverse perspectives, from different backgrounds –“To strive, to seek, to find, to not yield” — all into the fight for a better California.Thank you."
<label 49> : Subjective

Example 50:
<statement 50> : "A stellar young Alaskan who could not be here tonight also deserves some recognition."
<label 50> : Objective
PROMPT_PART_1:
Given the <context> of the following <sentence> from a political speech, does it contain any objective information?

<context>: "...{context}..."
<sentence>: "{sentence}"

Answer with Yes or No only.
PROMPT_PART_2:
Statements in political speech are usually based on facts to draw reasonable conclusions.

Categories of fact:
C1. Mentioning somebody (including the speaker) did or is doing something specific and objective.
C2. Quoting quantities, statistics, and data.
C3. Claiming a correlation or causation.
C4. Assertion of existing laws or rules of operation.
C5. Pledging a specific future plan or making specific predictions about future.

Please first analyze the objective and subjective information that the following <statement> (from a political speech) covers.
Then extract the fact that the <statement> is based on.
Then carefully reason about if the extracted fact is objectively verifiable.
Finally answer if the fact falls into the above categories (C1 to C5) or not (C0).

Context for <statement> to help you understand it better: "...{context}..."
<statement>: "{sentence}"

Format your answer in JSON with the following keys in order:
{{
    "ANALYSIS": "What are the objective and subjective information that <statement> covers?",
    "FACT_PART": "The extracted fact.",
    "VERIFIABLE_REASON": "Detailed reason about the extracted fact's verifiability. Note that a fact lacks important details or can be interpreted differently is not objectively verifiable. Future plans/pledge (C5) that are specific and clear can be verifiable. Citing others' words is verifiable and falls into C1. ",
    "VERIFIABILITY": "A boolean value indicates the verifiability.",
    "CATEGORY": "C1 to C5, or C0."
}}
PROMPT_OBJECTIVE:
Concisely argue that the following <sentence> from a political speech does contain some objective information.

Context of <sentence> in the speech: "...{context}..."
<sentence>: "{sentence}"
PROMPT_SUBJECTIVE:
Concisely argue that the following <sentence> from a political speech does not contain any objective information.

Context of <sentence> in the speech: "...{context}..."
<sentence>: "{sentence}"
JUDGE_PROMPT:
Two AI assistants are debating about whether the following <sentence> (from a political speech) contains any objectively verifiable information.

Context of <sentence> in the speech: "...{context}..."
<sentence>: "{sentence}"

Assistant A's View: "{assistant_a}"

Assistant B's View: "{assistant_b}"

Based on the above, does <sentence> contain any objectively verifiable information? Which perspective do you align with more closely?
Please reply with "Lean towards A", or "Lean towards B" only.
